[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [BlockRetrievalRequest attack] Can malicious BlockRetrievalRequest with extreme block ranges cause memory exhaustion in responders? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [EpochRetrievalRequest attack] Can EpochRetrievalRequest for very old epochs cause resource exhaustion during proof construction? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [EpochRetrievalRequest attack] Can invalid epoch ranges in EpochRetrievalRequest cause integer overflow or incorrect proof generation? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [BatchMsg attack] Can BatchMsg with extremely large transaction counts cause memory exhaustion during batch processing? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [BatchMsg attack] Can BatchMsg contain invalid transactions that cause execution failures but pass initial validation? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [BatchRequestMsg attack] Can BatchRequestMsg be used to request non-existent batches repeatedly, causing DoS on batch storage? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [SignedBatchInfo attack] Can SignedBatchInfoMsg signatures be forged or replayed to falsely indicate batch availability? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [ProofOfStoreMsg attack] Can ProofOfStoreMsg contain incorrect quorum certificates that appear valid but reference invalid batches? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [CommitVoteMsg attack] Can CommitVoteMsg with incorrect execution results cause disagreement among validators on committed state? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [CommitDecisionMsg attack] Can CommitDecisionMsg be sent before proper verification, causing premature commit finalization? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [DAGMessage attack] Can DAGMessage be used to inject invalid DAG vertices that bypass consensus ordering? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [CommitMessage attack] Can CommitMessage reliable broadcast be exploited to cause inconsistent commit delivery across validators? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [RandGenMessage attack] Can RandGenMessage be manipulated to bias randomness generation in leader election? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [OrderVoteMsg attack] Can OrderVoteMsg be sent prematurely before quorum certificates are validated, causing ordering inconsistencies? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [RoundTimeoutMsg attack] Can RoundTimeoutMsg be broadcast falsely to force unnecessary round changes and degrade liveness? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [OptProposalMsg attack] Can OptProposalMsg be used to bypass normal proposal validation in optimistic execution paths? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Cross-component] Can ConsensusMsg routing be exploited to send messages to components that shouldn't receive them (e.g., sending DAGMessage to non-DAG validators)? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Cross-component] Can message type confusion between consensus and quorum store components cause state inconsistencies? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Cross-component] Can the lack of component-specific validation in network interface allow unauthorized message routing? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Cross-component] Can messages intended for one epoch be delivered to validators in a different epoch, causing protocol confusion? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Network protocol] [Man-in-the-middle] Are network connections between validators using ConsensusNetworkClient properly encrypted and authenticated? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Network protocol] [Message integrity] Is there cryptographic integrity checking on ConsensusMsg to detect tampering in transit? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Network protocol] [Replay protection] Does the network layer implement nonces or sequence numbers to prevent message replay attacks? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Network protocol] [Forward secrecy] Do the RPC and DIRECT_SEND protocols provide forward secrecy to protect past messages if keys are compromised? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/network_interface.rs] [Memory safety] [Box allocation] Can the extensive use of Box types in ConsensusMsg variants cause memory leaks if messages are not properly dropped? (Low)
